oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Georgia state Civil War monument
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Georgia state Civil War monument in Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park.

The Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park, the first and largest military park in the United States, is located at the Civil War battle sites for the Battle of Chickamauga and the Siege of Chattanooga. The park was established in 1890 to preserve the sites of military maneuvers and to also hold monuments and memorials to military organizations as well as states whose troops participated in fights at the location. The formal dedication of the park took place in 1895.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:coverage: Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.)
